history.content:
can't really say much since i dont know, but would like to take the chance and ask what did you think about 126? I want to take it my very last semester along EE 130 and would like some feedback if possible :) (workload, uses a lot of CS70, hardships you faced, etc.) 
Sorry again for not being of much help, but if you (or anyone as a matter of fact) can help out it will be greatly appreciated!

children.subject:
oops my bad, I'm not very familiar with Piazza yet 😅. 
Okayy will definitely look more into it, thank you so much! and good luck!

<md>Posting as a followup so that this question looks unresolved. In other Piazzas it's been said that it's bad form to use the answer box for non-answers, for this reason -- IDK about here.

(I'm taking EECS 126 right now and EECS 126 does start out with a nice comfortable review of probability content from CS 70. The rest looks like it might continue to reteach a lot of CS 70 stuff (Markov chains, linear regression, MLE/MAP, etc.), but that's just based on [the course website](https://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~ee126/sp22/), which is open for anyone to look at. Rumor has it that the workload is heavy, but I can't tell yet.)</md>

I think Stat 135 is a great class and would teach you about a variety of statistical methods such as Inference, Hypothesis Testing, and Linear Models, additionally depending on the professor will go into more applied and modern stuff with EDA and hands-on data stuff.

history.content: Title? What would I gain from taking stat 135 after CS 70 and EECS 126? Thanks!
history.subject: Taking stat 135 after CS 70 and EECS 126
